fields.title: WE BELIEVE
fields.title_tag: God  I know you can hear
fields.body:
Akoben Site Audit Questionnaire

  1. Legal and administrative compliance – validity of permit and environmental management

    1. Company has valid environmental permit

[ ] Yes 100%

[ ] No 0%

[ ] In process 50%

1.2 If “In Process” to (1) above, did the company submit EMP for permit renewal two months before expiry?

[ ] Yes submitted 2 months before expiry 50%

[ ] Yes submitted at the time the permit expired 25%

[ ] No submitted after permit expired 0%


 

1.3 Company has submitted all quarterly returns by the end of the following month.

[ ] yes – three or more quarterly submissions 100%

[ ] Yes – less than three quarterly submissions 75%

[ ] No submissions 0%


 

1.4 Company has submitted the Annual Environmental Report by the end of the first quarter of the following year.

[ ] submitted within the first quarter 100%

[ ] submitted after the first quarter but before mid-year 75%

[ ] submitted after mid-year 50%

[ ] not submitted 0%


 

  1. Hazardous and toxic waste Management


 

  1. If the company uses hazardous chemicals or generates hazardous waste, has EPA been notified?

[ ] Yes – uses hazardous chemicals or generates hazardous waste and has notified EPA 100%

[ ] Yes – uses hazardous chemicals or generates hazardous waste and has not notified EPA of the complete list 50%

[ ] Yes – uses hazardous chemicals or generates hazardous waste and has not notified EPA 0%

[ ] Not applicable


 

  1. Are hazardous chemicals and waste properly stored and handled at the site?

[ ] Yes – hazardous chemicals and wastes stored and handled in accordance with MSDS 100%

[ ] Partial – only some hazardous chemicals and waste stores and handled in accordance with MSDS 50%

[ ] No proper system for storage and handling 0%

[ ] Not applicable


 

2.3 Does the company comply with effluent quality parameters for toxic parameters?

[ ] Yes – effluent quality parameters for toxic comply with the Ghana Standard for effluent for 98% or more 100%

[ ] Partial – effluent quality parameters for toxic comply with the Ghana Standard for effluent for less than 98% 50%

[ ] No - effluent quality parameters for toxic do not comply with the Ghana Standard for effluent 0%

[ ] Not applicable


 

3. Compliance Management System

3.1 Does the company have appropriate system for managing effluent quality to meet required guidelines?

[ ] Yes – Has complete treatment system that functions to meet sector standard 100%

[ ] Yes – Has partial treatment system that functions or systems that partially functions 75%

[ ] Yes – Has treatment system but does not function 25%

[ ] Yes – No treatment system 0%

[ ] Not Applicable – no effluent generated


 

3.2 Does the company have appropriate system for managing cooling water discharges to meet required guidelines?

[ ] Cooling water discharge that meet the Ghana Standards with complete sludge management 100%

[ ] Cooling water discharge that meet the Ghana Standards with incomplete sludge management 50%

[ ] Cooling water discharge that partially meet the Ghana Standard with complete sludge management 50%

[ ] Cooling water discharge that partially meet the Ghana Standard with incomplete sludge management 0%

[ ] Not Applicable – no effluent generated


 

3.3 Does the company have appropriate system for managing air quality to meet required guidelines?

[ ] Yes – Has complete air pollution control system that functions to meet Ghana standard 100%

[ ] Yes – Has incomplete air pollution control that function or system that partially functions 50%

[ ] Yes – Has air pollution control system but does not function 25%

[ ] No air pollution control system 0%

[ ] Not Applicable – No process air pollution


 

3.4 Does company have appropriate system for managing ambient noise pollution?

[ ] Yes – Has complete noise control system that functions to meet the Ghana Standard 100%

[ ] Yes – Has incomplete noise control system 50%

[ ] No control system 0%

[ ] Not Applicable


 

4.0 Environmental Management System

4.1 Does the company have environmental policy objectives and targets?

[ ] Yes 100%

[ ] No 0%

4.2 Are environmental management roles and responsibilities properly defined and communicated?

[ ]Yes 100%

[ ] No 0%

4.3 How many staffs are regularly trained on environmental issues?

[ ] Yes – 50% or more trained 100%

[ ] Yes – less than 50% trained 50%

[ ] No training 0%

4.4 Are there procedures for communicating environmental issues to employees?

[ ] Yes – procedures are documented 100%

[ ] Yes – only verbally explained 75%

[ ] No procedures 0%

4.5 Does the company conduct environmental audit?

[ ] Yes-audit report available 100%

[ ] Yes-audit report not available but there is evidence that audit was conducted 50%

[ ] No audit 0%


 

5 Water and Energy Use

5.1 Is the process water use monitored and reported to EPA?

[ ] Yes-75% or more reports 100%

[ ] Yes Less than 75% reports 75%

[ ] No report to EPA 0%

[ ] Not Applicable-No water use for processing

5.2 Is the non-process water use monitored and reported to EPA?

[ ] Yes-75% or more reports 100%

[ ] Yes-Less than 75% reports 75%

[ ] No report to EPA 0%


 

5.3 Is the energy consumption monitored and reported to EPA?

[ ] Yes-75% or more reports 100%

[ ] Yes-Less than 75% reports 75%

[ ] No report to EPA 0%


 

5.4 Does the company record the energy generated on site?

[ ] Yes – full data available 100%

[ ] Yes – partial data available 75%

[ ] No 0%

[ ] Not Applicable No on-site generation


 

5.5 Does the company use energy from renewable sources (biomass, solar, other)?

[ ] Yes 100%

[ ] No 0%

[ ] Not Applicable (for thermal plants)


 

6 Responsiveness to Environmental Complaints

6.1 The company has Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for handling verbal and written public complaints

[ ] Yes – procedure documented 100%

[ ] Yes – procedure not documented 50%

[ ] No procedure 0%


 

6.2 The company has proper recording system to register and track public complaints.

[ ] Yes – proper recording system available 100%

[ ] Yes – some recording system available 50%

[ ] No 0%

6.3 The company regularly and accurately reports the complaints to EPA in its Quarterly/Annual Environmental Reports

[ ] Yes complete & accurate reporting 100%

[ ] Yes partial & inaccurate reporting 50%

[ ] No reporting 0%

[ ] Not Applicable

6. 4 The company has addressed all complaints and that there is no unresolved environmental complaint

[ ] Yes-All complaints addressed 100%

[ ] Yes-50% or more complaints addressed 75%

[ ] Yes-less than 50% complaint addressed 50%

[ ] No complaints addressed 0%

[ ] Not Applicable - No complaints received

 

7 Implementation of Corporate Social Responsibility Policy

 

7.1 Does the company have a formal CSR Policy?

[ ]Yes, has formal policy/ social development schemes (SDS) 100%

[ ] No 0%

 

7.2 Is the CSR policy published or available for public access?

[ ] Yes-Available to the public on the internet, journals, newsletters factory

premises and on request etc. 100%

[ ] No CSR policy/social development schemes 0%

 

7.3 Does the CSR programmes/SDS support community/regional/national development?

[ ]Yes 100%

[ ] No 0%

 

7.4 The CSR programmes/SDS supports consultation with community.

[ ]Yes 100%

[ ] No 0%

 

7.5 The CSR programmes/SDS support local training and economic empowerment of

communities.

[ ] Yes 100%

[ ] No 0%

fields.title: jk
fields.title_tag: God  I know you can hear

fields.title: geo
fields.body:
6.5 Sortie graphique
Plusieurs sorties graphiques sont possibles depuis votre session. Nous en avons déjà vue une dans la section Les
projets : sauvegarder dans un fichier de projet. Voici d’autres manières de produire une sortie graphique :
Enregistrer comme image... ouvre une fenêtre où vous devez saisir le
• L’option de menu Projet →
nom, le chemin et le type d’image (PNG, JPEG ou de nombreux autres formats). Un fichier “worldfile”
avec le même nom et avec l’extension PNGW ou JPGW est enregistré dans le même dossier que l’image,
géoréférence celle-ci.
• Dans le menu Projet → Export DXF..., on peut choisir certains paramètres pour l’export en DXF : le mode
et l’échelle de la symbologie. De plus, on peut sélectionner les couches vecteurs à exporter. L’option ‘Mode
de symbologie’ permet d’exporter avec fidélité les symboles utilisés dans le projet QGIS d’origine.
Nouveau composeur d’impression ouvre une fenêtre où vous pouvez faire
• L’option de menu Projet →
une mise en page et imprimer la vue active de la carte (voir section Composeur d’Impression).
